subject: OT: final
msgSnippet: ... In this case, my disciplined use of final helps the compiler/interpreter/whatever optimize on my behalf, nothing more. As a side-effect, though, I have
messageBody:
>So said Mike Clark on 2003-05-07 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>But of course. I had at least twenty useful abbreviations for jEdit,
>including
>>
>>forEach#String#myStrings#
>>
>>which became
>>
>>for (final Iterator myStringsIterator = myStrings.iterator();
>myStringsIterator.hasNext(); ) {
>> final String eachString = (String) myStringsIterator.next();
>> [CURSOR HERE]
>>}
>>
>>
>
>Just an off-topic observation that piqued my curiosity...
>
>Given your disciplined use of 'final', I'd conclude you have a fear that
>the String objects might be reassigned to the detriment of the program.
>Why is that?

In this case, my disciplined use of final helps the compiler/interpreter/whatever optimize on my behalf, nothing more.

As a side-effect, though, I have noticed that making most object references 'final' leads to better code. It's just an opinion and a feeling that I have never been able to adequately express to others.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
